What Buy-Side Hiring Managers Look For

Track Record & Returns

Quantified performance vs. benchmarks, risk-adjusted returns, and attribution analysis

Investment Process

Your analytical framework, research methodology, and decision-making approach

AUM & Scope

Portfolio size, asset classes covered, and investment mandate complexity

Technical Depth

Bloomberg, FactSet, modeling capabilities, and quantitative skills

Before & After Examples

Generic responsibility → Quantified track record

BEFORE

Managed equity portfolios and conducted investment research

AFTER

Managed $450M US large-cap equity portfolio, outperforming S&P 500 by 280bps annually over 3-year period with 0.85 beta

Vague analysis → Clear investment process

BEFORE

Analyzed companies for potential investment opportunities

AFTER

Developed proprietary screening model analyzing 500+ mid-cap companies quarterly, generating 15 high-conviction ideas that drove 40% of portfolio alpha

Missing context → Full investment story

BEFORE

Participated in investment committee meetings

AFTER

Presented 25+ stock pitches to investment committee, with 18 approved positions generating average return of 23% vs. 12% benchmark

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I present performance numbers appropriately?

We'll help you present returns in context—showing benchmark-relative performance, risk-adjusted metrics (Sharpe, Sortino), and time periods. Compliance-friendly framing is essential, and we understand the nuances.

Should I include my CFA designation?

Absolutely—CFA is highly valued in asset management. We'll ensure proper placement and formatting per CFA Institute guidelines. If you're a candidate, we'll appropriately note your progress.

I'm transitioning from sell-side. Can you help?

Yes. Sell-side to buy-side transitions are common. We'll help you reframe your coverage experience to emphasize investment judgment, idea generation, and analytical depth rather than client service.

How do you handle different asset classes?

Whether you're in equities, fixed income, alternatives, or multi-asset, we tailor feedback to your specific asset class. The metrics and language differ between a credit analyst and an equity PM.

Ready to Advance Your Buy-Side Career?

In asset management, your track record speaks loudest. Make sure your resume tells the right story.
